column2: This is a sequence of text known as a string. To signify that the value is a string, enclose it in single quote marks.
This is a number. Numbers don't have quotes around them.
This is a True/False value. The words true and false are special keywords that don't need quote marks.
This is a structure that allows you to store multiple values in a single reference.
column3: let myVariable = [1,'Bob','Steve',10];Refer to each member of the array like this:myVariable[0], myVariable[1], etc.

column2: This can be anything. Everything in JavaScript is an object and can be stored in a variable. Keep this in mind as you learn.
column3: let myVariable = document.querySelector('h1');All of the above examples too.
